org.factcenter.qilin.protocols

Interface ProtocolParty

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BulkOT.Receiver, BulkOT.Sender, BulkOT.SplitReceiver, BulkOT.SplitSender, CommitmentPoK.Prover<C,P,R>, CommitmentPoK.Verifier<C,P,R>, OT1of2.Chooser, OT1of2.Sender, OTExtender, SigmaProtocol.Prover<Params>, SigmaProtocol.Verifier<Params>, TrapdoorCommitmentPoK.TrapdoorProver<C,P,R>, TrapdoorTwoPartyGroupElementFlip.TrapdoorFirst<G>, TwoPartyGroupElementFlip.First<G>, TwoPartyGroupElementFlip.Second<G>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BlumTwoPartyGroupElementFlip.First, BlumTwoPartyGroupElementFlip.Second, DefaultOTExtender, DummyOTExtender, ECPedersenCommitmentPoK.Prover, ECPedersenCommitmentPoK.TrapdoorProver, ECPedersenCommitmentPoK.Verifier, HomomorphicCommitmentPoK.Prover, HomomorphicCommitmentPoK.Verifier, NaorPinkasOT.Chooser, NaorPinkasOT.Sender, OTExtensionServer, PrecomputedOTClient, ProtocolPartyBase, TrapdoorBlumTwoPartyGroupElementFlip.TrapdoorFirst, TrapdoorHomomorphicCommitmentPoK.TrapdoorProver

    public interface ProtocolParty
    A ProtocolParty defines the basic functions every participant in a protocol should implement.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void init()
      Perform any required initialization.
      void setParameters(Channel toPeer, java.util.Random rand)
      Set the channel used to communicate with the peer and the randomness used to generate messages.

    • Method Detail

      • setParameters

        void setParameters(Channel toPeer,
                   java.util.Random rand)
        Set the channel used to communicate with the peer and the randomness used to generate messages.
        Parameters:
        toPeer -

      • init

        void init()
   throws java.io.IOException
        Perform any required initialization. This might involve communication with the peer. This method is meant for setup that is performed once; "setup" that is performed for every protocol execution should be done in the protocol itself.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
